title: Dcubed raises 4.4 million euros for in-space manufacturing
summary: LOGAN, Utah — German startup Dcubed raised 4.4 million euros ($4.8 million) in a Series A funding round. With the investment, announced Aug. 5, Dcubed will expand production, demonstrate in-space […]

title: NASA & SpaceX Delay Crew 9 To September 24 Due To Starliner Mission Delays
summary: NASA & SpaceX Delay Crew 9 To September 24 Due To Starliner Mission Delays

title: NASA chief will make the final decision on how Starliner crew flies home
summary: "I especially have confidence since I have the final decision."

title: Impulse Space announces GEO rideshare program
summary: Orbital transfer vehicle developer Impulse Space will offer rideshare services for spacecraft going to geostationary orbit using its Helios tug, along with an upgraded version of its Mira vehicle.

title: U.S. Army seeks to expand space expertise among soldiers
summary: The Space and Missile Defense Command is backing an initiative to create a dedicated space career field for enlisted troops

title: Safran to open electric thruster production line in U.S.
summary: Safran Electronics & Defense will establish a new production line for satellite electric propulsion systems in the United States to serve commercial and U.S. government customers.

title: Doomed Star Eta Carinae
summary: Eta Carinae may be about to explode. But no one knows when – it may be next year, it may be one million years from now. Eta Carinae’s mass – about 100 times greater than our Sun – makes it an excellent candidate for a full blown supernova. Historical records do show that about 170 […]

title: NASA pushes Crew-9 launch to September amid uncertainty of Starliner’s return timeline
summary: The adjustment of the launch manifest is in line with NASA’s desire to have a direct handover between its two long-duration crews on the International Space Station.

title: NASA to Provide Crew Flight Test, Space Station Missions Update
summary: NASA will host a media teleconference at 12:30 p.m. EDT, Wednesday, Aug. 7, to discuss ongoing International Space Station operations, including the agency’s Boeing Crew Flight Test and NASA’s SpaceX Crew-9 mission.   Audio of the briefing will stream live on NASA’s website. title: Tundra Vegetation to Grow Taller, Greener Through 2100, NASA Study Finds
summary: Warming global climate is changing the vegetation structure of forests in the far north. It’s a trend that will continue at least through the end of this century, according to NASA researchers. The change in forest structure could absorb more of the greenhouse gas carbon dioxide (CO2) from the atmosphere, or increase permafrost thawing, resulting […]
